channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: HoW-3D: Holistic 3D Wireframe Perception from a Single Image
item.description: This paper studies the problem of holistic 3D wireframe perception (HoW-3D), a new task of perceiving both the visible 3D wireframes and the invisible ones from single-view 2D images.

item.title: Unsupervised Video Domain Adaptation: A Disentanglement Perspective
item.description: Specifically, we consider the generation of cross-domain videos from two sets of latent factors, one encoding the static domain-related information and another encoding the temporal and semantic-related information.

item.title: A Unified Causal View of Domain Invariant Representation Learning
item.description: Machine learning methods can be unreliable when deployed in domains that differ from the domains on which they were trained.

item.title: Efficient Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems with Response Selection as an Auxiliary Task
item.description: The adoption of pre-trained language models in task-oriented dialogue systems has resulted in significant enhancements of their text generation abilities.

item.title: Analysis of impact of emotions on target speech extraction and speech separation
item.description: One of the factors causing such degradation may be intrinsic speaker variability, such as emotions, occurring commonly in realistic speech.

item.title: Z-BERT-A: a zero-shot Pipeline for Unknown Intent detection
item.description: The main challenge resides in the need to identify from input utterances novel unseen in-tents.

item.title: How Does Data Freshness Affect Real-time Supervised Learning?
item.description: To minimize the inference error in real-time, we propose a new "selection-from-buffer" model for sending the features, which is more general than the "generate-at-will" model used in earlier studies.

item.title: Applying Regularized Schr√∂dinger-Bridge-Based Stochastic Process in Generative Modeling
item.description: Therefore, this study tried to reduce the number of timesteps and training time required and proposed regularization terms to the existing SB models to make the bidirectional stochastic processes consistent and stable with a reduced number of timesteps.

item.title: Pyramidal Predictive Network: A Model for Visual-frame Prediction Based on Predictive Coding Theory
item.description: The main innovation of our model is that the update frequency of neural units on each of the layer decreases with the increasing of network levels, which results in the model appears like a pyramid from the perspective of time dimension, so we call it the Pyramid Predictive Network (PPNet).

item.title: Online Pole Segmentation on Range Images for Long-term LiDAR Localization in Urban Environments
item.description: We further use the extracted poles as pseudo labels to train a deep neural network for online range image-based pole segmentation.

item.title: Enhancing Deep Learning-based 3-lead ECG Classification with Heartbeat Counting and Demographic Data Integration
item.description: Nowadays, an increasing number of people are being diagnosed with cardiovascular diseases (CVDs), the leading cause of death globally.

item.title: InvisibiliTee: Angle-agnostic Cloaking from Person-Tracking Systems with a Tee
item.description: After a survey for person-tracking system-induced privacy concerns, we propose a black-box adversarial attack method on state-of-the-art human detection models called InvisibiliTee.

item.title: ROLAND: Graph Learning Framework for Dynamic Graphs
item.description: Finally, we propose a scalable and efficient training approach for dynamic GNNs via incremental training and meta-learning.

item.title: DM-NeRF: 3D Scene Geometry Decomposition and Manipulation from 2D Images
item.description: In this paper, we study the problem of 3D scene geometry decomposition and manipulation from 2D views.

item.title: Towards Interpretable Sleep Stage Classification Using Cross-Modal Transformers
item.description: Here, we propose Cross-Modal Transformers, which is a transformer-based method for sleep stage classification.

item.title: SYN-MAD 2022: Competition on Face Morphing Attack Detection Based on Privacy-aware Synthetic Training Data
item.description: The competition attracted a total of 12 participating teams, both from academia and industry and present in 11 different countries.

item.title: Hierarchical Attention Network for Few-Shot Object Detection via Meta-Contrastive Learning
item.description: We propose a hierarchical attention network with sequentially large receptive fields to fully exploit the query and support images.

item.title: Computational Empathy Counteracts the Negative Effects of Anger on Creative Problem Solving
item.description: In an online experiment with 1, 006 participants randomly assigned to an emotion elicitation intervention (with a control elicitation condition and anger elicitation condition) and a computational empathy intervention (with a control virtual agent and an empathic virtual agent), we examine how anger and empathy influence participants' performance in solving a word game based on Wordle.

item.title: Man-in-the-Middle Attack against Object Detection Systems
item.description: Is deep learning secure for robots?

item.title: Self-Supervised Vision Transformers for Malware Detection
item.description: Malware detection plays a crucial role in cyber-security with the increase in malware growth and advancements in cyber-attacks.

item.title: Combining Gradients and Probabilities for Heterogeneous Approximation of Neural Networks
item.description: We further demonstrate that our error model can predict the parameters of an approximate multiplier in the context of the commonly used additive Gaussian noise (AGN) model with high accuracy.

item.title: WiFi Based Distance Estimation Using Supervised Machine Learning
item.description: However, measuring the spatial distance between given set of WiFi fingerprints is heavily affected by the selection of the signal distance function used to model signal space as geospatial distance.

item.title: ELEVANT: A Fully Automatic Fine-Grained Entity Linking Evaluation and Analysis Tool
item.description: We present Elevant, a tool for the fully automatic fine-grained evaluation of a set of entity linkers on a set of benchmarks.

item.title: Multi-Attribute Open Set Recognition
item.description: While conventional OSR approaches can detect Out-of-Distribution (OOD) samples, they cannot provide explanations indicating which underlying visual attribute(s) (e. g., shape, color or background) cause a specific sample to be unknown.

item.title: Flow-Guided Transformer for Video Inpainting
item.description: Especially in spatial transformer, we design a dual perspective spatial MHSA, which integrates the global tokens to the window-based attention.

item.title: HighlightNet: Highlighting Low-Light Potential Features for Real-Time UAV Tracking
item.description: Pixel-level range mask is introduced to make HighlightNet more focused on the enhancement of the tracking object and regions without light sources.

item.title: HyP$^2$ Loss: Beyond Hypersphere Metric Space for Multi-label Image Retrieval
item.description: Image retrieval has become an increasingly appealing technique with broad multimedia application prospects, where deep hashing serves as the dominant branch towards low storage and efficient retrieval.

item.title: Fast Learning Radiance Fields by Shooting Much Fewer Rays
item.description: Experimental results show that our method achieves comparable accuracy to the state-of-the-art with much faster training.

item.title: Link-Backdoor: Backdoor Attack on Link Prediction via Node Injection
item.description: Consequently, the link prediction model trained on the backdoored dataset will predict the link with trigger to the target state.

item.title: GNPassGAN: Improved Generative Adversarial Networks For Trawling Offline Password Guessing
item.description: This approach, however, needs domain-specific knowledge and expertise that are difficult to duplicate.

item.title: Visual Localization via Few-Shot Scene Region Classification
item.description: Visual (re)localization addresses the problem of estimating the 6-DoF (Degree of Freedom) camera pose of a query image captured in a known scene, which is a key building block of many computer vision and robotics applications.

item.title: Shuffle Instances-based Vision Transformer for Pancreatic Cancer ROSE Image Classification
item.description: The rapid on-site evaluation (ROSE) technique can signifi-cantly accelerate the diagnosis of pancreatic cancer by im-mediately analyzing the fast-stained cytopathological images.

item.title: TripJudge: A Relevance Judgement Test Collection for TripClick Health Retrieval
item.description: Robust test collections are crucial for Information Retrieval research.

item.title: AVisT: A Benchmark for Visual Object Tracking in Adverse Visibility
item.description: While being greatly benefiting to the tracking research, existing benchmarks do not pose the same difficulty as before with recent trackers achieving higher performance mainly due to (i) the introduction of more sophisticated transformers-based methods and (ii) the lack of diverse scenarios with adverse visibility such as, severe weather conditions, camouflage and imaging effects.

item.title: MTCSNN: Multi-task Clinical Siamese Neural Network for Diabetic Retinopathy Severity Prediction
item.description: The novelty of this project is to utilize the ordinal information among labels and add a new regression task, which can help the model learn more discriminative feature embedding for fine-grained classification tasks.

item.title: Virgo: Scalable Unsupervised Classification of Cosmological Shock Waves
item.description: Cosmological shock waves are essential to understanding the formation of cosmological structures.

item.title: Frouros: A Python library for drift detection in Machine Learning problems
item.description: Frouros is a Python library capable of detecting drift in machine learning problems.

item.title: An approach to generalizing some impossibility theorems in social choice
item.description: In social choice theory, voting methods can be classified by invariance properties: a voting method is said to be C1 if it selects the same winners for any two profiles of voter preferences that produce the same majority graph on the set of candidates; a voting method is said to be pairwise if it selects the same winners for any two preference profiles that produce the same weighted majority graph on the set of candidates; and other intermediate classifications are possible.

item.title: CoShNet: A Hybird Complex Valued Neural Network using Shearlets
item.description: In a hybrid neural network, the expensive convolutional layers are replaced by a non-trainable fixed transform with a great reduction in parameters.

item.title: Imputation Strategies Under Clinical Presence: Impact on Algorithmic Fairness
item.description: First, we provide a structured view of the relationship between clinical presence mechanisms and group-specific missingness patterns.

item.title: BenchPress: A Deep Active Benchmark Genertor
item.description: We develop BenchPress, the first ML benchmark generator for compilers that is steerable within feature space representations of source code.

item.title: ExpansionNet v2: Block Static Expansion in fast end to end training for Image Captioning
item.description: Expansion methods explore the possibility of performance bottlenecks in the input length in Deep Learning methods.

item.title: Modeling Network-level Traffic Flow Transitions on Sparse Data
item.description: DTIGNN models the traffic system as a dynamic graph influenced by traffic signals, learns the transition models grounded by fundamental transition equations from transportation, and predicts future traffic states with imputation in the process.

item.title: An Empirical Comparison of Explainable Artificial Intelligence Methods for Clinical Data: A Case Study on Traumatic Brain Injury
item.description: The implemented methods were compared to one another in terms of several XAI characteristics such as understandability, fidelity, and stability.

item.title: Self-Contained Entity Discovery from Captioned Videos
item.description: This paper introduces the task of visual named entity discovery in videos without the need for task-specific supervision or task-specific external knowledge sources.

item.title: On the Limitations of Continual Learning for Malware Classification
item.description: To our surprise, continual learning methods significantly underperformed naive Joint replay of the training data in nearly all settings -- in some cases reducing accuracy by more than 70 percentage points.

item.title: Self-supervised Contrastive Representation Learning for Semi-supervised Time-Series Classification
item.description: Specifically, we propose time-series specific weak and strong augmentations and use their views to learn robust temporal relations in the proposed temporal contrasting module, besides learning discriminative representations by our proposed contextual contrasting module.

item.title: Learning Linear Non-Gaussian Polytree Models
item.description: In the context of graphical causal discovery, we adapt the versatile framework of linear non-Gaussian acyclic models (LiNGAMs) to propose new algorithms to efficiently learn graphs that are polytrees.

item.title: Locating disparities in machine learning
item.description: As a result, ALD helps practitioners and researchers of algorithmic fairness to detect disparities in machine learning algorithms, so that disparate -- or even unfair -- outcomes can be mitigated.

item.title: Self-supervised Matting-specific Portrait Enhancement and Generation
item.description: Particularly, we invert an input portrait into the latent code of StyleGAN, and our aim is to discover whether there is an enhanced version in the latent space which is more compatible with a reference matting model.
